intro: Astragalus tarapacanus, commonly known as the Tarapacá milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Chile. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant thrives in saline and alkaline soils, often found in coastal areas and desert environments. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and is adapted to withstand extreme drought conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological significance make it an important species in its native habitat.
